subject: Re: [junit] Testing XML-RPC and SOAP server responses
msgSnippet: ... Most of what you ll do is verify XML documents. You can do that one of two ways: 1. Use XPath directly assertNotNull(XPathAPI.selectSingleNode(
messageBody:
suman291857 wrote:

> Iam a newbie to JUnit.I want to test my SOAP and XML-RPC server
> responses using JUnit.Can anybody let me know more about how to do
> this.

Most of what you'll do is verify XML documents. You can do that one of
two ways:

1. Use XPath directly

assertNotNull(XPathAPI.selectSingleNode(
responseDocument, "//myTag[@myAttribute='expectedValue']"));

2. Use XMLUnit.

This will at least help you verify that response documents are correct.
It still involves invoking the real web service which may or may not be
necessary, depending on what you're trying to test.
